task_summary: The robot pours the contents of a cup into a mug, first approaching and aligning the cup above the mug, then performing the pour action, and finally retreating.

task_long_description.overview: This episode depicts a robot arm executing a pouring task. The robot is holding a cup filled with liquid, and its objective is to accurately and steadily pour the contents into a mug placed on a table. The process involves perceiving both the mug and the cup, approaching and aligning above the mug, tilting the cup to pour, and finally retreating. The workspace is a tabletop, and no obstacles or other objects interfere with the operation.
preconditions: Cup is grasped and contains liquid.
Mug is placed on the table within reachable workspace.
Robotic arm and gripper are operational.
stepwise_plan: Perceive mug location and verify visibility.
Perceive and verify the cup in gripper.
Approach and align cup above mug with precise tolerance.
Move to pouring position above the mug.
Pour from cup into mug by tilting at appropriate angle.
Retreat to safe position after pouring.
success_criteria: Liquid is transferred from cup to mug without major spillage.
Cup is correctly positioned above mug before pouring.
Pour action completes within allowed timeout.
failure_and_recovery: Failure to detect mug or cup: Retry detection.
Misalignment leads to spillage: Abandon pour, retreat.
Pour incomplete: Retry pour if safe.
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when pouring sequence is complete and robot has retreated to idle.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if the target mug is visible.
Detects the mug if it is not currently visible.
Checks if the held cup is visible.
Detects the cup if it is not currently visible.
Approaches and aligns the cup above the mug with precise tolerance.
Moves the cup to a position above the mug, ready for pouring.
Pours from the cup into the mug with a normal rate at 45 degrees.
Retreats from the mug after pouring.
Waits briefly at the end of the task.

recovery_strategy: Abort and retreat if misalignment detected
Skip pour if prerequisites not satisfied
assumptions: Visual inspection shows a cup (used as pour source) is grasped throughout; mug is present as target.
No explicit force or liquid parameters are visible, so these are omitted.
Frames 0-2 show approach/alignment, 3-5 show pouring, 6-8 show retreat.
Instruction does not specify pour rate or amount; defaults used.

expected_success_criteria: Cup is accurately positioned above mug before pouring
Pour action is executed and liquid transferred without excessive spillage
